value.description: Comma-separated list of Hadoop Configuration files, such as hbase-site.xml and core-site.xml for kerberos, including full paths to the files.
value.name: Hadoop Configuration Files

value.description: Kerberos principal to authenticate as. Requires nifi.kerberos.krb5.file to be set in your nifi.properties
value.name: Kerberos Principal

value.description: Kerberos keytab associated with the principal. Requires nifi.kerberos.krb5.file to be set in your nifi.properties
value.name: Kerberos Keytab

value.description: Comma-separated list of ZooKeeper hosts for HBase. Required if Hadoop Configuration Files are not provided.
value.name: ZooKeeper Quorum

value.description: The port on which ZooKeeper is accepting client connections. Required if Hadoop Configuration Files are not provided.
value.name: ZooKeeper Client Port

value.description: The ZooKeeper ZNode Parent value for HBase (example: /hbase). Required if Hadoop Configuration Files are not provided.
value.name: ZooKeeper ZNode Parent

value.description: The number of times the HBase client will retry connecting. Required if Hadoop Configuration Files are not provided.
value.name: HBase Client Retries

value.description: Specifies the Controller Service to use for accessing HBase.
value.name: HBase Client Service

value.description: The name of the HBase Table to put data into
value.name: Table Name

value.description: Specifies the Row ID to use when inserting data into HBase
value.name: Row Identifier

value.description: Specifies the name of a JSON element whose value should be used as the row id for the given JSON document.
value.name: Row Identifier Field Name

value.description: The Column Family to use when inserting data into HBase
value.name: Column Family

value.description: The maximum number of FlowFiles to process in a single execution. The FlowFiles will be grouped by table, and a single Put per table will be performed.
value.name: Batch Size

allowableValues.description: Route entire FlowFile to failure if any elements contain complex values.
Provide a warning and do not include field in row sent to HBase.
Silently ignore and do not include in row sent to HBase.
Use the string representation of the complex field as the value of the given column.

value.description: Indicates how to handle complex fields, i.e. fields that do not have a single text value.
value.name: Complex Field Strategy

value.description: The fully-qualified filename of the Keystore
value.name: Keystore Filename

value.description: The password for the Keystore
value.name: Keystore Password

value.description: The Type of the Keystore
value.name: Keystore Type

value.description: The fully-qualified filename of the Truststore
value.name: Truststore Filename

value.description: The password for the Truststore
value.name: Truststore Password

value.description: The Type of the Truststore. Either JKS or PKCS12
value.name: Truststore Type

value.description: The algorithm to use for this SSL context
value.name: SSL Protocol

value.description: Base path for incoming connections
value.name: Base Path

value.description: The Port to listen on for incoming connections
value.name: Listening Port

entry.key: Max Data to Receive per Second

value.description: The maximum amount of data to receive per second; this allows the bandwidth to be throttled to a specified data rate; if not specified, the data rate is not throttled
value.displayName: Max Data to Receive per Second
value.name: Max Data to Receive per Second

value.description: The Controller Service to use in order to obtain an SSL Context
value.name: SSL Context Service

value.description: A Regular Expression to apply against the Distinguished Name of incoming connections. If the Pattern does not match the DN, the connection will be refused.
value.name: Authorized DN Pattern

value.description: The maximum amount of time to wait for a FlowFile to be confirmed before it is removed from the cache
value.name: Max Unconfirmed Flowfile Time

entry.key: HTTP Headers to receive as Attributes (Regex)

value.description: Specifies the Regular Expression that determines the names of HTTP Headers that should be passed along as FlowFile attributes
value.displayName: HTTP Headers to receive as Attributes (Regex)
value.name: HTTP Headers to receive as Attributes (Regex)

labels.label:
Lookup filters for the devices are generated in Spark Streaming and fed back to Kafka.
Commands can be sent via SSL web service

allowableValues.description: Generates 'bins' of FlowFiles and fills each bin as full as possible. FlowFiles are placed into a bin based on their size and optionally their attributes (if the <Correlation Attribute> property is set)

Combines fragments that are associated by attributes back into a single cohesive FlowFile. If using this strategy, all FlowFiles must have the attributes <fragment.identifier>, <fragment.count>, and <fragment.index> or alternatively (for backward compatibility purposes) <segment.identifier>, <segment.count>, and <segment.index>. All FlowFiles with the same value for "fragment.identifier" will be grouped together. All FlowFiles in this group must have the same value for the "fragment.count" attribute. All FlowFiles in this group must have a unique value for the "fragment.index" attribute between 0 and the value of the "fragment.count" attribute.

value.description: Specifies the algorithm used to merge content. The 'Defragment' algorithm combines fragments that are associated by attributes back into a single cohesive FlowFile. The 'Bin-Packing Algorithm' generates a FlowFile populated by arbitrarily chosen FlowFiles
value.name: Merge Strategy

allowableValues.description: A bin of FlowFiles will be combined into a single TAR file. The FlowFiles' <path> attribute will be used to create a directory in the TAR file if the <Keep Paths> property is set to true; otherwise, all FlowFiles will be added at the root of the TAR file. If a FlowFile has an attribute named <tar.permissions> that is 3 characters, each between 0-7, that attribute will be used as the TAR entry's 'mode'.

A bin of FlowFiles will be combined into a single ZIP file. The FlowFiles' <path> attribute will be used to create a directory in the ZIP file if the <Keep Paths> property is set to true; otherwise, all FlowFiles will be added at the root of the ZIP file. The <Compression Level> property indicates the ZIP compression to use.
A bin of FlowFiles will be combined into a single Version 3 FlowFile Stream
A bin of FlowFiles will be combined into a single Version 2 FlowFile Stream
A bin of FlowFiles will be combined into a single Version 1 FlowFile Package
The contents of all FlowFiles will be concatenated together into a single FlowFile
The Avro contents of all FlowFiles will be concatenated together into a single FlowFile

value.description: Determines the format that will be used to merge the content.
value.name: Merge Format

value.description: Determines which FlowFile attributes should be added to the bundle. If 'Keep All Unique Attributes' is selected, any attribute on any FlowFile that gets bundled will be kept unless its value conflicts with the value from another FlowFile. If 'Keep Only Common Attributes' is selected, only the attributes that exist on all FlowFiles in the bundle, with the same value, will be preserved.
value.name: Attribute Strategy

value.description: If specified, like FlowFiles will be binned together, where 'like FlowFiles' means FlowFiles that have the same value for this Attribute. If not specified, FlowFiles are bundled by the order in which they are pulled from the queue.
value.name: Correlation Attribute Name

value.description: The minimum number of files to include in a bundle
value.name: Minimum Number of Entries

value.description: The maximum number of files to include in a bundle. If not specified, there is no maximum.
value.name: Maximum Number of Entries

value.description: The minimum size of for the bundle
value.name: Minimum Group Size

value.description: The maximum size for the bundle. If not specified, there is no maximum.
value.name: Maximum Group Size

value.description: The maximum age of a Bin that will trigger a Bin to be complete. Expected format is <duration> <time unit> where <duration> is a positive integer and time unit is one of seconds, minutes, hours
value.name: Max Bin Age

value.description: Specifies the maximum number of bins that can be held in memory at any one time
value.name: Maximum number of Bins

allowableValues.description: The values of Header, Footer, and Demarcator will be retrieved from the contents of a file
The values of Header, Footer, and Demarcator will be specified as property values

value.description: Determines if Header, Footer, and Demarcator should point to files containing the respective content, or if the values of the properties should be used as the content.
value.name: Delimiter Strategy

value.description: Filename specifying the header to use. If not specified, no header is supplied. This property is valid only when using the binary-concatenation merge strategy; otherwise, it is ignored.
value.name: Header File

value.description: Filename specifying the footer to use. If not specified, no footer is supplied. This property is valid only when using the binary-concatenation merge strategy; otherwise, it is ignored.
value.name: Footer File

value.description: Filename specifying the demarcator to use. If not specified, no demarcator is supplied. This property is valid only when using the binary-concatenation merge strategy; otherwise, it is ignored.
value.name: Demarcator File

value.description: Specifies the compression level to use when using the Zip Merge Format; if not using the Zip Merge Format, this value is ignored
value.name: Compression Level

value.description: If using the Zip or Tar Merge Format, specifies whether or not the FlowFiles' paths should be included in their entry names; if using other merge strategy, this value is ignored
value.name: Keep Path

relationships.description: If the bundle cannot be created, all FlowFiles that would have been used to created the bundle will be transferred to failure
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: The FlowFile containing the merged content
relationships.name: merged

relationships.description: The FlowFiles that were used to create the bundle
relationships.name: original

value.description: A file or comma separated list of files which contains the Hadoop file system configuration. Without this, Hadoop will search the classpath for a 'core-site.xml' and 'hdfs-site.xml' file or will revert to a default configuration.
value.name: Hadoop Configuration Resources

value.description: Kerberos principal to authenticate as. Requires nifi.kerberos.krb5.file to be set in your nifi.properties
value.name: Kerberos Principal

value.description: Kerberos keytab associated with the principal. Requires nifi.kerberos.krb5.file to be set in your nifi.properties
value.name: Kerberos Keytab

value.description: Period of time which should pass before attempting a kerberos relogin
value.name: Kerberos Relogin Period

value.description: The parent HDFS directory to which files should be written
value.name: Directory

value.description: Indicates what should happen when a file with the same name already exists in the output directory
value.name: Conflict Resolution Strategy

value.description: Size of each block as written to HDFS. This overrides the Hadoop Configuration
value.name: Block Size

value.description: Amount of memory to use to buffer file contents during IO. This overrides the Hadoop Configuration
value.name: IO Buffer Size

value.description: Number of times that HDFS will replicate each file. This overrides the Hadoop Configuration
value.name: Replication

value.description: A umask represented as an octal number which determines the permissions of files written to HDFS. This overrides the Hadoop Configuration dfs.umaskmode
value.name: Permissions umask

value.description: Changes the owner of the HDFS file to this value after it is written. This only works if NiFi is running as a user that has HDFS super user privilege to change owner
value.name: Remote Owner

value.description: Changes the group of the HDFS file to this value after it is written. This only works if NiFi is running as a user that has HDFS super user privilege to change group
value.name: Remote Group

relationships.description: Files that could not be written to HDFS for some reason are transferred to this relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: Files that have been successfully written to HDFS are transferred to this relationship
relationships.name: success

inputPorts.name: from Sensor
inputPorts.validationErrors: 'Port 'from Sensor'' is invalid because Output connection for port 'from Sensor' is not defined.

value.description: The Search Value to search for in the FlowFile content. Only used for 'Literal Replace' and 'Regex Replace' matching strategies
value.name: Regular Expression

value.description: The value to insert using the 'Replacement Strategy'. Using "Regex Replace" back-references to Regular Expression capturing groups are supported, but back-references that reference capturing groups that do not exist in the regular expression will be treated as literal value. Back References may also be referenced using the Expression Language, as '$1', '$2', etc. The single-tick marks MUST be included, as these variables are not "Standard" attribute names (attribute names must be quoted unless they contain only numbers, letters, and _).
value.name: Replacement Value

value.description: The Character Set in which the file is encoded
value.name: Character Set

value.description: Specifies the maximum amount of data to buffer (per file or per line, depending on the Evaluation Mode) in order to apply the replacement. If 'Entire Text' (in Evaluation Mode) is selected and the FlowFile is larger than this value, the FlowFile will be routed to 'failure'. In 'Line-by-Line' Mode, if a single line is larger than this value, the FlowFile will be routed to 'failure'. A default value of 1 MB is provided, primarily for 'Entire Text' mode. In 'Line-by-Line' Mode, a value such as 8 KB or 16 KB is suggested. This value is ignored if the <Replacement Strategy> property is set to one of: Append, Prepend, Always Replace
value.name: Maximum Buffer Size

allowableValues.description: Insert the Replacement Value at the beginning of the FlowFile or the beginning of each line (depending on the Evaluation Mode). For "Line-by-Line" Evaluation Mode, the value will be prepended to each line. For "Entire Text" evaluation mode, the value will be prepended to the entire text.

Insert the Replacement Value at the end of the FlowFile or the end of each line (depending on the Evluation Mode). For "Line-by-Line" Evaluation Mode, the value will be appended to each line. For "Entire Text" evaluation mode, the value will be appended to the entire text.

Interpret the Search Value as a Regular Expression and replace all matches with the Replacement Value. The Replacement Value may reference Capturing Groups used in the Search Value by using a dollar-sign followed by the Capturing Group number, such as $1 or $2. If the Search Value is set to .* then everything is replaced without even evaluating the Regular Expression.
Search for all instances of the Search Value and replace the matches with the Replacement Value.

Always replaces the entire line or the entire contents of the FlowFile (depending on the value of the <Evaluation Mode> property) and does not bother searching for any value. When this strategy is chosen, the <Search Value> property is ignored.

value.description: The strategy for how and what to replace within the FlowFile's text content.
value.name: Replacement Strategy

value.description: Run the 'Replacement Strategy' against each line separately (Line-by-Line) or buffer the entire file into memory (Entire Text) and run against that.
value.name: Evaluation Mode

relationships.description: FlowFiles that could not be updated are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: FlowFiles that have been successfully processed are routed to this relationship. This includes both FlowFiles that had text replaced and those that did not.
relationships.name: success

value.description: The Search Value to search for in the FlowFile content. Only used for 'Literal Replace' and 'Regex Replace' matching strategies
value.name: Regular Expression

value.description: The value to insert using the 'Replacement Strategy'. Using "Regex Replace" back-references to Regular Expression capturing groups are supported, but back-references that reference capturing groups that do not exist in the regular expression will be treated as literal value. Back References may also be referenced using the Expression Language, as '$1', '$2', etc. The single-tick marks MUST be included, as these variables are not "Standard" attribute names (attribute names must be quoted unless they contain only numbers, letters, and _).
value.name: Replacement Value

value.description: The Character Set in which the file is encoded
value.name: Character Set

value.description: Specifies the maximum amount of data to buffer (per file or per line, depending on the Evaluation Mode) in order to apply the replacement. If 'Entire Text' (in Evaluation Mode) is selected and the FlowFile is larger than this value, the FlowFile will be routed to 'failure'. In 'Line-by-Line' Mode, if a single line is larger than this value, the FlowFile will be routed to 'failure'. A default value of 1 MB is provided, primarily for 'Entire Text' mode. In 'Line-by-Line' Mode, a value such as 8 KB or 16 KB is suggested. This value is ignored if the <Replacement Strategy> property is set to one of: Append, Prepend, Always Replace
value.name: Maximum Buffer Size

allowableValues.description: Insert the Replacement Value at the beginning of the FlowFile or the beginning of each line (depending on the Evaluation Mode). For "Line-by-Line" Evaluation Mode, the value will be prepended to each line. For "Entire Text" evaluation mode, the value will be prepended to the entire text.

Insert the Replacement Value at the end of the FlowFile or the end of each line (depending on the Evluation Mode). For "Line-by-Line" Evaluation Mode, the value will be appended to each line. For "Entire Text" evaluation mode, the value will be appended to the entire text.

Interpret the Search Value as a Regular Expression and replace all matches with the Replacement Value. The Replacement Value may reference Capturing Groups used in the Search Value by using a dollar-sign followed by the Capturing Group number, such as $1 or $2. If the Search Value is set to .* then everything is replaced without even evaluating the Regular Expression.
Search for all instances of the Search Value and replace the matches with the Replacement Value.

Always replaces the entire line or the entire contents of the FlowFile (depending on the value of the <Evaluation Mode> property) and does not bother searching for any value. When this strategy is chosen, the <Search Value> property is ignored.

value.description: The strategy for how and what to replace within the FlowFile's text content.
value.name: Replacement Strategy

value.description: Run the 'Replacement Strategy' against each line separately (Line-by-Line) or buffer the entire file into memory (Entire Text) and run against that.
value.name: Evaluation Mode

relationships.description: FlowFiles that could not be updated are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: FlowFiles that have been successfully processed are routed to this relationship. This includes both FlowFiles that had text replaced and those that did not.
relationships.name: success

allowableValues.description: A copy of the FlowFile will be routed to each relationship whose corresponding expression evaluates to 'true'
Requires that all user-defined expressions evaluate to 'true' for the FlowFile to be considered a match
Requires that at least one user-defined expression evaluate to 'true' for hte FlowFile to be considered a match

value.description: Specifies how to determine which relationship to use when evaluating the Expression Language
value.name: Routing Strategy

relationships.description: FlowFiles that do not match any user-define expression will be routed here
relationships.name: unmatched

value.description: Determines how the load will be distributed. If using Round Robin, will not distribute any FlowFiles unless all destinations can accept FlowFiles; when using Next Available, will distribute FlowFiles as long as at least 1 destination can accept FlowFiles.
value.name: Distribution Strategy

value.description: Specifies the Controller Service to use for accessing HBase.
value.name: HBase Client Service

value.description: The name of the HBase Table to put data into
value.name: Table Name

value.description: Specifies the Row ID to use when inserting data into HBase
value.name: Row Identifier

value.description: Specifies the name of a JSON element whose value should be used as the row id for the given JSON document.
value.name: Row Identifier Field Name

value.description: The Column Family to use when inserting data into HBase
value.name: Column Family

value.description: The maximum number of FlowFiles to process in a single execution. The FlowFiles will be grouped by table, and a single Put per table will be performed.
value.name: Batch Size

allowableValues.description: Route entire FlowFile to failure if any elements contain complex values.
Provide a warning and do not include field in row sent to HBase.
Silently ignore and do not include in row sent to HBase.
Use the string representation of the complex field as the value of the given column.

value.description: Indicates how to handle complex fields, i.e. fields that do not have a single text value.
value.name: Complex Field Strategy

relationships.description: A FlowFile is routed to this relationship if it cannot be sent to HBase
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: A FlowFile is routed to this relationship after it has been successfully stored in HBase
relationships.name: success

value.description: The Connection String to use in order to connect to ZooKeeper. This is often a comma-separated list of <host>:<port> combinations. For example, host1:2181,host2:2181,host3:2188
value.name: ZooKeeper Connection String

value.description: The Kafka Topic to pull messages from
value.name: Topic Name

value.description: Specifies how often to communicate with ZooKeeper to indicate which messages have been pulled. A longer time period will result in better overall performance but can result in more data duplication if a NiFi node is lost
value.name: Zookeeper Commit Frequency

value.description: Specifies the maximum number of messages to combine into a single FlowFile. These messages will be concatenated together with the <Message Demarcator> string placed between the content of each message. If the messages from Kafka should not be concatenated together, leave this value at 1.
value.name: Batch Size

value.description: Specifies the characters to use in order to demarcate multiple messages from Kafka. If the <Batch Size> property is set to 1, this value is ignored. Otherwise, for each two subsequent messages in the batch, this value will be placed in between them.
value.name: Message Demarcator

value.description: Client Name to use when communicating with Kafka
value.name: Client Name

value.description: A Group ID is used to identify consumers that are within the same consumer group
value.name: Group ID

value.description: The amount of time to wait for a response from Kafka before determining that there is a communications error
value.name: Kafka Communications Timeout

value.description: The amount of time to wait for a response from ZooKeeper before determining that there is a communications error
value.name: ZooKeeper Communications Timeout

value.description: Automatically reset the offset to the smallest or largest offset available on the broker
value.name: Auto Offset Reset

relationships.description: All FlowFiles that are created are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: A comma-separated list of known Kafka Brokers in the format <host>:<port>
value.name: Known Brokers

value.description: The Kafka Topic of interest
value.name: Topic Name

allowableValues.description: Messages will be assigned partitions in a round-robin fashion, sending the first message to Partition 1, the next Partition to Partition 2, and so on, wrapping as necessary.
Messages will be assigned to random partitions.
The <Partition> property will be used to determine the partition. All messages within the same FlowFile will be assigned to the same partition.

value.description: Specifies how messages should be partitioned when sent to Kafka
value.name: Partition Strategy

value.description: Specifies which Kafka Partition to add the message to. If using a message delimiter, all messages in the same FlowFile will be sent to the same partition. If a partition is specified but is not valid, then all messages within the same FlowFile will use the same partition but it remains undefined which partition is used.
value.name: Partition

value.description: The Key to use for the Message
value.name: Kafka Key

allowableValues.description: FlowFile will be routed to success after successfully writing the content to a Kafka node, without waiting for a response. This provides the best performance but may result in data loss.

FlowFile will be routed to success if the message is received by a single Kafka node, whether or not it is replicated. This is faster than <Guarantee Replicated Delivery> but can result in data loss if a Kafka node crashes
FlowFile will be routed to failure unless the message is replicated to the appropriate number of Kafka Nodes according to the Topic configuration

value.description: Specifies the requirement for guaranteeing that a message is sent to Kafka
value.name: Delivery Guarantee

value.description: Specifies the delimiter (interpreted in its UTF-8 byte representation) to use for splitting apart multiple messages within a single FlowFile. If not specified, the entire content of the FlowFile will be used as a single message. If specified, the contents of the FlowFile will be split on this delimiter and each section sent as a separate Kafka message. Note that if messages are delimited and some messages for a given FlowFile are transferred successfully while others are not, the messages will be split into individual FlowFiles, such that those messages that were successfully sent are routed to the 'success' relationship while other messages are sent to the 'failure' relationship.
value.name: Message Delimiter

value.description: The maximum amount of data to buffer in memory before sending to Kafka
value.name: Max Buffer Size

value.description: The maximum size that any individual record can be.
value.name: Max Record Size

value.description: The amount of time to wait for a response from Kafka before determining that there is a communications error
value.name: Communications Timeout

value.description: The number of messages to send in one batch. The producer will wait until either this number of messages are ready to send or "Queue Buffering Max Time" is reached. NOTE: This property will be ignored unless the 'Message Delimiter' property is specified.
value.name: Async Batch Size

value.description: Maximum time to buffer data before sending to Kafka. For example a setting of 100 ms will try to batch together 100 milliseconds' worth of messages to send at once. This will improve throughput but adds message delivery latency due to the buffering.
value.name: Queue Buffering Max Time

allowableValues.description: Compression will not be used for any topic.
Compress messages using GZIP
Compress messages using Snappy

value.description: This parameter allows you to specify the compression codec for all data generated by this producer.
value.name: Compression Codec

value.description: Client Name to use when communicating with Kafka
value.name: Client Name

relationships.description: Any FlowFile that cannot be sent to Kafka will be routed to this Relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: Any FlowFile that is successfully sent to Kafka will be routed to this Relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: Regular expression for attributes to be deleted from flowfiles.
value.name: Delete Attributes Expression

relationships.description: All FlowFiles are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: Regular expression for attributes to be deleted from flowfiles.
value.name: Delete Attributes Expression

relationships.description: All FlowFiles are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: Base path for incoming connections
value.name: Base Path

value.description: The Port to listen on for incoming connections
value.name: Listening Port

entry.key: Max Data to Receive per Second

value.description: The maximum amount of data to receive per second; this allows the bandwidth to be throttled to a specified data rate; if not specified, the data rate is not throttled
value.displayName: Max Data to Receive per Second
value.name: Max Data to Receive per Second

value.description: The Controller Service to use in order to obtain an SSL Context
value.name: SSL Context Service

value.description: A Regular Expression to apply against the Distinguished Name of incoming connections. If the Pattern does not match the DN, the connection will be refused.
value.name: Authorized DN Pattern

value.description: The maximum amount of time to wait for a FlowFile to be confirmed before it is removed from the cache
value.name: Max Unconfirmed Flowfile Time

entry.key: HTTP Headers to receive as Attributes (Regex)

value.description: Specifies the Regular Expression that determines the names of HTTP Headers that should be passed along as FlowFile attributes
value.displayName: HTTP Headers to receive as Attributes (Regex)
value.name: HTTP Headers to receive as Attributes (Regex)

HTTP Headers to receive as Attributes (Regex)

processors.name: Listen for Command to Send to Devices

relationships.description: Relationship for successfully received FlowFiles
relationships.name: success

allowableValues.description: A SolrCloud instance.
A stand-alone Solr instance.

value.description: The type of Solr instance, Cloud or Standard.
value.name: Solr Type

value.description: The Solr url for a Solr Type of Standard (ex: http://localhost:8984/solr/gettingstarted), or the ZooKeeper hosts for a Solr Type of Cloud (ex: localhost:9983).
value.name: Solr Location

value.description: The Solr collection name, only used with a Solr Type of Cloud
value.name: Collection

value.description: The path in Solr to post the ContentStream
value.name: Content Stream Path

value.description: Content-Type being sent to Solr
value.name: Content-Type

value.description: The number of milliseconds before the given update is committed
value.name: Commit Within

value.description: The amount of time to wait for data on a socket connection to Solr. A value of 0 indicates an infinite timeout.
value.name: Solr Socket Timeout

value.description: The amount of time to wait when establishing a connection to Solr. A value of 0 indicates an infinite timeout.
value.name: Solr Connection Timeout

value.description: The maximum number of total connections allowed from the Solr client to Solr.
value.name: Solr Maximum Connections

value.description: The maximum number of connections allowed from the Solr client to a single Solr host.
value.name: Solr Maximum Connections Per Host

value.description: The amount of time to wait for data on a connection to ZooKeeper, only used with a Solr Type of Cloud.
value.name: ZooKeeper Client Timeout

value.description: The amount of time to wait when establishing a connection to ZooKeeper, only used with a Solr Type of Cloud.
value.name: ZooKeeper Connection Timeout

relationships.description: FlowFiles that failed because Solr is unreachable
relationships.name: connection_failure

relationships.description: FlowFiles that failed for any reason other than Solr being unreachable
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: The original FlowFile
relationships.name: success
